We're taking a trip to SoCal circa '83 for this one....

"Product of my environment" by the Circle Jerks

overheard drunks

sitting in bars

talking 'bout sex

talking 'bout cars

talking 'bout football

women at lunch

they just keep talking

but don't say much



i'm a product of my environment

my vocabularies like licking the gutter

words that cut so sharp

cuts like a hot knife through butter



not my fault

but then again

schools and teachers were never my friends

nothing's wrong with a little education

but i don't need a new vocation



i'm a product of my environment

things that occur

events take place

that will wipe

the smile right off your face



freeways=2Ctraffic=2Csmog=2C

movies=2Ctheatres=2C

lines of people=2C

markets and banks

who the hell i'm i supposed to thank??

i'm a product of my environment

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Hendrix' drummer is dead.  RIP Mitch Mitchell

Jimi Hendrix drummer found dead in Portland hotel

03:59 PM PST on Wednesday, November 12, 2008

By DAVID KROUGH, kgw.com and AP Staff

PORTLAND, Ore. -- The Jimi Hendrix Experience's drummer Mitch Mitchell
was found dead in a downtown Portland hotel Wednesday.

The Multnomah County Medical Examiner's office said 61-year-old Mitch
Mitchell likely died of natural causes. His body was found just after
3 a.m. at the Benson Hotel.  An autopsy was scheduled for Wednesday.

Mitchell had been playing with the Experience Hendrix tour that just
made a stop in Portland at the Schnitz last Friday.

Mitchell along with bass players Noel Redding and Billy Cox backed
Hendrix for the generation defining sounds of his electrified
psychedelic blues. The Experience played behind Hendrix at Woodstock
and the Isle of Wight festivals in the late 1960s.

Hendrix died in 1970, Redding died in 2003. Mitchell was with the
group from 1966-69.



-- 
San Francisco Bay Guardian's Readers Choice Award Winner: Best Radio DJ:
http://www.sfbg.com/promo/pollpositions.php
AIM: jckzsu (or kzsudj during my show.)

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Courtesy of Washington DC's own Government Issue...

"The Next Time" by G.I.

Situations and advice I'm hearing

Was it just you or talk?

I painted a dreary picture

And built it around your face



Next time=2C you hear word of mouth

Next time=2C come straight to me

Next time=2C put away the hearsay

The next time



We're too good friends for this

I wouldn't hurt you no matter what

The scene is just an empty dream -

And who wants to face reality?

Subject: [sfraves] review: prohibition underground

Remember when you went to a party and afterward the whole world seemed fres=
h, new, and alive?=A0 When you left with a head full of ideas about what mi=
ght be possible?=A0=0A=0AOh it was probably a long time ago now...=0A=0AMay=
be you had come to believe that the magic was gone from the world, or maybe=
 (even worse) you had started to tell yourself that it could never really h=
ave been quite like you remembered it in th efirst place.=A0 =0A=0AWell I a=
m here to tell you that the magic is alive and well and it still works.=0A=
=0ARaver 101, as we all know when you bring together the three ingredients,=
 that's when the magic happens.=A0 And the most important of the three, the=
 vibe, well its so often missing from parities these days.=0A=0ANot the cas=
e at Prohibition.=A0 The vibe was thick and there wasn't a frown in sight.=
=A0 =0A=0AI met so many people that just seemed to be in the best mood and =
were ready to have it.=A0 There were first timers, old school heads, candy =
ravers, weirdos, locals, and more.=A0=A0Its not often that you can get this=
 sort of mixed crowd to work, so often people just don't connect.=A0But the=
 magic was in effect Saturday night.=0A=0ASome highlights...a guy and his n=
ewlywed wife that had driven from Mississippi specifically to go to this pa=
rty.=A0 I am not joking.=A0 She did some research on teh Internets and some=
how landed at theparty.=A0 Good choice!...Leon and his two buddies, locals,=
 that were just having a great time and were sweet.=A0 Leon had just turned=
 21 and for some reason thought my wife needed a huge gin and=A0juice...all=
 the various flappers, guys in suits, misc. longhairs, the green fairy, oh =
I forget all of you right now...=0A=0AOf course the music was great and I e=
specially enjoyed Ethan's set as I had never seen him play before.=A0 Dragn=
'fly and Forest brought it as always.=A0=A0 And it was great to see Bam who=
 I hadn't seen for a few months.=A0 We briefly renewed our shoe rivalry.=A0=
 Pumas FTW bitch!=A0 Visuals were great and fit the theme perfectly.=A0 The=
 arrival of the police did force a reduction in bass levels sadly, but the =
party just kept rocking anyway...=0A=0ASfravers in the house included Philp=
 Diaz, Osby, the laser powered Ray Wong, Tim Smith, and=A0his beautiful wif=
e,=A0who did I forget?=A0 Sorry!=0A=0AThis party really opened the door to =
more events of=A0a similar stature=A0in my opinion.=A0 I hope everyone invo=
lved with producing the event came away with that feeling and energy too.=
=A0 Thank you.=0A=0AIn summary: fuck yeah!=0A=0APeter

Courtesy of some of the dirtiest Vato punks this side o' the Mississippi...=
Suicidal Tendencies

"INSTITUTIONALIZED"

Sometimes I try to do things but it just doesn't work out the way I
want it to=2C and I get real frustrated and then like I try hard to do
it=2C and I like=2C take my time but it just doesn't work out the way I
want it to. Its like=2C I concentrate on it real hard=2C but it just
doesn't work out. And everything I do and everything I try=2C it never
turns out. Its like=2C I need time to figure these things out=2C but there'=
s
always someone there going =93hey mike=2C you know we've been noticing
you've been having a lot of problems lately=2C you know? You need to
maybe get away. And like=2C maybe you should talk about it=2C you'll feel a
lot better.=94 And I'm all like =93oh=2C nah=2C its ok=2C you know. I'll fi=
gure
it out. Just leave me alone=2C I'll figure it out=2C you know? I'm just
working on it by myself.=94 And they go =93well=2C you know=2C if you wanna
talk about it=2C I'll be here=2C you know? And you'll probably feel a lot
better if you talk about it. So why don't you talk about it?=94 I go =93no=
=2C
I don't want to! I'm ok. I'll figure it out myself!=94 But they just keep
bugging me=2C they just keep bugging me=2C and it builds up inside.



So you're gonna be institutionalized. You'll come out brainwashed with bloo=
dshot eyes.=20

You won't have anything to say. They'll brainwash you until you see their w=
ay.=20



I'm not crazy - institutionalized

You're the one that's crazy - institutionalized

You're driving me crazy - institutionalized

They stuck me in an institution=2C said it was the only solution

To give me the needed professional help to protect me from the enemy=2C mys=
elf.



I was in my room and I was just like staring at the wall thinking about
everything=2C but then again I was thinking about nothing. And then my
mom came in=2C and I didn't even know she was there. She called my name
and I didn't hear her and then she started screaming =93Mike=2C Mike!=94 An=
d
I go =93what? Whats the matter?=94 She goes =93whats the matter with you?=
=94 I
go =93there's nothing wrong=2C mom.=94 Shes all =93don't tell me that! You'=
re on
drugs!=94 I go =93no mom I'm not on drugs. I'm ok=2C I'm just thinking=2C y=
ou
know? Why don't you get me a Pepsi?=94 She goes =93No! You're on drugs!=94 =
I
go =93mom=2C I'm ok. I'm just thinking.=94 She goes =93No! You're not think=
ing=2C
you're on drugs! Normal people don't be acting that way!=94 I go =93mom=2C
just get me a Pepsi! Please=2C all I want is a Pepsi!=94 And she wouldn't
give it to me! All I wanted was a Pepsi=2C just one Pepsi=2C and she
wouldn't give it to me! Just a Pepsi!



They give you a white shirt with long sleeves! Tied around your back=2C you=
're treated like thieves!=20

Drug you up because they're lazy! It's too much work to help a crazy!



I'm not crazy - institutionalized

You're the one who's crazy - institutionalized

You're driving me crazy - institutionalized

They stuck me in an institution=2C said it was the only solution

To give me the needed professional help=2C to protect me from the enemy=2C =
myself.



I'm sitting in my room=2C when my mom and my dad came in. they pulled up
a chair and they sat down. They go =93mike=2C we need to talk to you.=94 An=
d
I go =93ok=2C whats the matter?=94 They go =93me and your mom=2C we've noti=
ced
that lately you've been having a lot of problems=2C and you've been going
off for no reason=2C and we're afraid you're going to hurt somebody=2C and
we're afraid you're going to hurt yourself. So we decided that it would
be in you're best interest if we put you somewhere where you could get
the help that you need.=94 And I go =93wait=2C what are you talking about=
=2C WE
decided? MY best interests? How do you know what MY best interest is?
How can you say what MY best interest is? What are you trying to say?
I'M crazy? When I went to YOUR schools=2C I went to YOUR churches=2C I went
to YOUR institutional learning facilities. So how can you say I'M
crazy?=94



They say they're gonna fix my brain. Alleviate my suffering and my pain.=20

But by the time they fix my head. Mentally I'll be dead.



I'm not crazy - institutionalized

You're the one who's crazy - institutionalized

You're driving me crazy - institutionalized

They stuck me in an institution=2C said it was the only solution

To give me the needed professional help=2C to protect me from the enemy=2C =
myself.



Doesn't matter=2C I'll probably get hit by a car anyways.

I love hearing about Dawn's successes, we used to sneak her into a place 
before she was old enough to drink so she could get her techno on in San 
Jose.

And as for the FCC thing... playing the occasional "whoops" on the radio 
is fun and usually ignored, but you should have seen the looks I was 
getting the year I decided to play a "best of smutty dancemania and 
chicago jack records" set for the Love Parade (thanks Def-SF!).  Passing 
by families and police officers on Embarcadero while blasting "Come on 
make that pussy squirt" and pounding a 40oz on the back of a truck is a 
very special feeling.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] review: prohibition underground

I've encountered a couple small pockets of Authentic Rave recently
myself. Thank god, huh? Just...gotta...kick this bitch into gear...
*pulls rip-cord*

rave you little fuckers, raaave

On Mon, Nov 17, 2008 at 11:05 AM,  <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
> Remember when you went to a party and afterward the whole world seemed fresh, new, and alive?  When you left with a head full of ideas about what might be possible?
>
> Oh it was probably a long time ago now...
>
> Maybe you had come to believe that the magic was gone from the world, or maybe (even worse) you had started to tell yourself that it could never really have been quite like you remembered it in th efirst place.
>
> Well I am here to tell you that the magic is alive and well and it still works.
>
> Raver 101, as we all know when you bring together the three ingredients, that's when the magic happens.  And the most important of the three, the vibe, well its so often missing from parities these days.
>
> Not the case at Prohibition.  The vibe was thick and there wasn't a frown in sight.
>
> I met so many people that just seemed to be in the best mood and were ready to have it.  There were first timers, old school heads, candy ravers, weirdos, locals, and more.  Its not often that you can get this sort of mixed crowd to work, so often people just don't connect. But the magic was in effect Saturday night.
>
> Some highlights...a guy and his newlywed wife that had driven from Mississippi specifically to go to this party.  I am not joking.  She did some research on teh Internets and somehow landed at theparty.  Good choice!...Leon and his two buddies, locals, that were just having a great time and were sweet.  Leon had just turned 21 and for some reason thought my wife needed a huge gin and juice...all the various flappers, guys in suits, misc. longhairs, the green fairy, oh I forget all of you right now...
>
> Of course the music was great and I especially enjoyed Ethan's set as I had never seen him play before.  Dragn'fly and Forest brought it as always.   And it was great to see Bam who I hadn't seen for a few months.  We briefly renewed our shoe rivalry.  Pumas FTW bitch!  Visuals were great and fit the theme perfectly.  The arrival of the police did force a reduction in bass levels sadly, but the party just kept rocking anyway...
>
> Sfravers in the house included Philp Diaz, Osby, the laser powered Ray Wong, Tim Smith, and his beautiful wife, who did I forget?  Sorry!
>
> This party really opened the door to more events of a similar stature in my opinion.  I hope everyone involved with producing the event came away with that feeling and energy too.  Thank you.
>
> In summary: fuck yeah!
>
> Peter
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
> To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>
>



--

message in error, please advise the sender immediately by reply
e-email and delete this message. Thank you for your cooperation.

Ok=2C so yesterday I slacked on it...so you get 2 for the price of 1 today.=
..OI! Also=2C I am mixing it up a bit and adding in some Soundgarden lyrics=
=2C which are arguably "grunge" or "metal" and not "punk" - but what the fu=
ck ever - this song rips. Deal.

"Hands All Over" by Soundgarden

Hands all over the Eastern border

You know what? I think we're falling

from composure

Hands all over Western culture

Ruffling feathers and turning eagles into vultures



Got my arms around my baby brother

Put your hands away

Your gonna kill your mother=2C kill your mother

And I love her



Hands all over the coastal waters

The crew men thank her

Then lay down their oily blanket

Hands all over the inland forest

In a striking motion trees fall down

Like dying soldiers



Hands all over the peasants daughter

She's our bride

She'll never make it out alive

Hands all over words I utter

Change them into what you want to

Like balls of clay

Put your hands away

Your gonna kill your mother

And I love her


This next tune is by the NYC band Quicksand - a little more "post hardcore"=
 in terms of genre=2C but all the members of the band come from the NYHC mo=
vement and the agression of the tunes as well as lyrical content are punk a=
s fuck...

"Delusional" by Quicksand

Delusional=2C

Im not impressed.

You want to tell me SO BAD

who is on your guest list tonight -

but I don't care!


Save it for

One of your

Other friends -

Or your many fans.


Just think.

Just -

think solutional -

We have a problem.

We don't care who you know.

Its too bad that you think so.

Next time you drop a name.


Save it for

One of your

Other friends

Or your many fans.


Delusional=2C

Im not impressed.

Illusional -

Lies you tell best -

And you want me to know -

But I can't hear at all!


But I can't hear at all.

I can't hear at all.

But I can't hear at all.

I can't hear at all

and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for

> Oh yeah?  Tell us more...
> 
> Peter

> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Sean G <rationalhatter@gmail.com>
> To: dangrsmind@yahoo.com
> Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> Sent: Wednesday, November 19, 2008 9:51:16 AM
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] review: prohibition underground
> 
> I've encountered a couple small pockets of Authentic Rave recently
> myself. Thank god, huh? Just...gotta...kick this bitch into gear...
> *pulls rip-cord*
> 
> rave you little fuckers, raaave
> 
> On Mon, Nov 17, 2008 at 11:05 AM,  <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
> > Remember when you went to a party and afterward the whole world seemed fresh, new, and alive?  When you left with a head full of ideas about what might be possible?
> >
> > Oh it was probably a long time ago now...
> >
> > Maybe you had come to believe that the magic was gone from the world, or maybe (even worse) you had started to tell yourself that it could never really have been quite like you remembered it in th efirst place.
> >
> > Well I am here to tell you that the magic is alive and well and it still works.
> >
> > Raver 101, as we all know when you bring together the three ingredients, that's when the magic happens.  And the most important of the three, the vibe, well its so often missing from parities these days.
> >
> > Not the case at Prohibition.  The vibe was thick and there wasn't a frown in sight.
> >
> > I met so many people that just seemed to be in the best mood and were ready to have it.  There were first timers, old school heads, candy ravers, weirdos, locals, and more.  Its not often that you can get this sort of mixed crowd to work, so often people just don't connect. But the magic was in effect Saturday night.
> >
> > Some highlights...a guy and his newlywed wife that had driven from Mississippi specifically to go to this party.  I am not joking.  She did some research on teh Internets and somehow landed at theparty.  Good choice!...Leon and his two buddies, locals, that were just having a great time and were sweet.  Leon had just turned 21 and for some reason thought my wife needed a huge gin and juice...all the various flappers, guys in suits, misc. longhairs, the green fairy, oh I forget all of you right now...
> >
> > Of course the music was great and I especially enjoyed Ethan's set as I had never seen him play before.  Dragn'fly and Forest brought it as always.   And it was great to see Bam who I hadn't seen for a few months.  We briefly renewed our shoe rivalry.  Pumas FTW bitch!  Visuals were great and fit the theme perfectly.  The arrival of the police did force a reduction in bass levels sadly, but the party just kept rocking anyway...
> >
> > Sfravers in the house included Philp Diaz, Osby, the laser powered Ray Wong, Tim Smith, and his beautiful wife, who did I forget?  Sorry!
> >
> > This party really opened the door to more events of a similar stature in my opinion.  I hope everyone involved with producing the event came away with that feeling and energy too.  Thank you.
> >
> > In summary: fuck yeah!
> >
> > Peter
> >

> > For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

> > >

 ready to have it.  There were first timers=2C old school heads=2C candy ra=
vers=2C weirdos=2C locals=2C and more.  Its not often that you can get this=
 sort of mixed crowd to work=2C so often people just don't connect. But the=

d were sweet.  Leon had just turned 21 and for some reason thought my wife =
needed a huge gin and juice...all the various flappers=2C guys in suits=2C =
misc. longhairs=2C the green fairy=2C oh I forget all of you right now...
> > >
> > > Of course the music was great and I especially enjoyed Ethan's set as=
 I had never seen him play before.  Dragn'fly and Forest brought it as alwa=
ys.   And it was great to see Bam who I hadn't seen for a few months.  We b=
riefly renewed our shoe rivalry.  Pumas FTW bitch!  Visuals were great and =
fit the theme perfectly.  The arrival of the police did force a reduction i=
n bass levels sadly=2C but the party just kept rocking anyway...

And it was great to see Bam who I hadn't seen for a few months.  We briefly renewed our shoe rivalry.  Pumas FTW bitch!  Visuals were great and fit the theme perfectly. 	b=eHYDIe25Yy32QP8jpRJBeZF3kxHOFGR7aYyde23lqZsdusRtFmYMwV21oy/1rTxwKUvi7PUm2jxFLtbxRyNg96xmdoGwrDKudDEnlt5XjoKNYHOEfOePRUMM2ULr1WdM;

Subject: [sfraves] Another Prohibition Review - mine.

------=_NextPart_000_0108_01C94A58.63B0ABF0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Wow!=20

It's taken me a few days to come down to Earth enough to post up a =
proper reply, but finally after some much needed rest, it's time.

=20

Where do I start?  Well first & foremost, to all of you who came to =
dance, to smile, to meet new friends, to sing, to drink, to smoke & to =
chill; to those of you who came and donated your time, hell, even if you =
couldn't make it for one reason or another, yet made the point to send =
out best wishes to us - THANK YOU!  The night, as many have shared was =
nothing short of AMAZING!=20

=20

Anyone who knows me knows I've been pining to do an event for some years =
now.  It's been years since I've had a hand doing something with my OG =
Epiphany mates and with 2008 marking my 10 year in this crazy DJ life, =
both Terri & I just knew this had to be the time.  Searching high & low, =
it was difficult to find a venue that suited our needs.  But that all =
changed when the guys behind the Department of Spontaneous Combustion =
first entered into our lives over a year or so ago.  From the first time =
we entered their metal shop/studio space, we knew it was the one. From =
there it was a matter of timing. =20

=20

Fast forward to Aug 2008 . at a little campout called Memories.  It was =
inside our cabin that Forest & I (and Philip & Terri) had a little =
conversation. It was that little chat and a twist of fate set the stage =
for what would eventually become Prohibition Underground. =20

=20

We didn't have a theme to start.  Ideas were tossed around, but it was =
Terri who befell us with her idea for a Prohibition-themed event.  While =
it appeared well-timed, here inspiration had little to do with our =
country's current economic situation.  No, her vision stemmed from =
stories she'd grown up hearing about her great-grandparents, adventurers =
who  ran moonshine from Canada into Montana during the 20s as told by =
her own grandmother (who herself, along with her siblings, stayed in a =
house of "ill repute").  From the moment we heard her idea, we knew it =
was the perfect theme and one that could capture the spirit we were =
looking for if executed right.

=20

>From there, it was a matter of putting the right pieces together to make =
it all happen as we all had envisioned. =20

=20

In my 10 years as a DJ, I've been fortunate to gain the acceptance by =
many an audience, crew & collective. Whether they are young or old, =
veterans or virgins, jaded or anew, mainstream or underground it seems =
I've somehow been able to remain on common ground with everyone through =
the music I play that makes them dance.  And it's been a long held dream =
of mine that one night I'd get the chance to bring all of those worlds =
together and that's exactly what happened at Prohibition Underground.  =
For that single night, it didn't matter who was 18, who was 21 and who =
was neither; it didn't matter if they were from Sac or from the Bay or =
from somewhere else; it didn't matter how many parties they'd been to or =
how much things have changed; it didn't matter what color they were or =
what gender they identified with; it didn't matter what they smoked or =
what they drank or what else they may prefer to ingest; it didn't matter =
what their favorite genre was nor who they credited as their favorite =
DJ.  All that really mattered was that we were all together, =
experiencing something bigger than ourselves without much regard for the =
life we left behind for the time we chose to stay within those cement =
walls.  For the first time in a long time, there was a real sense of =
freedom and community that seemed to magically hang over all of us - I =
believe that had a huge hand in what we all came to experience that =
night.

=20

The list of those who helped make this happen in offering their time, =
energy & creativeness is long and many have been thanked many times over =
on this & other threads, but you can never give enough thanks to those =
whose efforts have genuinely touched lives.  So again, many thanks to =
Terri, Forest & Philip (I told you we'd do it and we did! & btw, P, your =
sound hits!), Ben Hansen (who set the tone with that flawless flyer), =
Viberation Terry (the most creative visual guru I've ever witnessed), =
Heroic Robot (colored lasers and you, in general, rawk!), both my bar =
staff (who did an amazing job keeping all those palettes satisfied =
especially with the 'ol style cocktail menu plus an honorable mention to =
Baker who brought the still and moonshine!), those who manned the front =
doors (there were some insanely crazy moments, but you all held it =
together nicely), the VIP door crew (btw, Chipy should work for the =
Secret Service), those who came and did a kick ass job helping us to set =
up (some arriving even earlier than any of us organizers - Ed & Alpha - =
woop woop), those who helped us clean up (I bow to you all!), the =
fabulous Mynx and the Temple of Poi (who proved they can be just as hot =
w/o the fire), to all the incredible DJs who kept the dance floor packed =
from START to END (with special hugs to Ethan Miller, one of my earliest =
sources of inspirations and the guy I used to train spot when I was just =
getting into this whole DJ thing), the Ambient Mafia (with special winks =
to my long time pals and Epiphany-ites Harken & Stickman), Josh =
(security that also promotes and does sound check is priceless), the DSC =
gang for the use of their incredible space, and finally to ALL OF YOU =
who came through the door already primed & ready to join in the =
celebration and willing to soak in all the good times. It was ultimately =
you who LENT the biggest hand of all in creating what ultimately became =
my "dream party".

=20

This is one I'll NEVER forget!

------=_NextPart_000_0108_01C94A58.63B0ABF0--

Tell you more? Well, how about last friday, the night before prohibition.

I've had my eye on this local crew, or collective... I'm not sure what
to call them, and the details of whose crew it is or who is in the
crew still seems kinda unclear. They've been posting over on the
galaxyraver.com message boards, throwing a series of slightly
unsuccessful, low-turnout renegades.

Then friday they finally hit the nail on the head. :) In a small glade
under a full moon somewhere in the north bay, they rafed and rafed. I
found it remarkable myself that I experienced that kind of dream-time
TAZ raveland experience. The drug consumption appeared remarkably low,
the kids were silly and friendly, but respectful and halfway bright.
I'd keep an eye on them, fursure.

Saturday, December 6th, 2008

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every 1st Saturday at The Endup



featuring from Berlin:

CASSY  - 3 hour DJ set

(panoramabar . perlon . uzuri . m_nus)
(playhouse . dessous . mental groove)

After growing up a musically-oriented child in London and
Vienna, Cassy Britton moved to Berlin in 2003 to pursue a
full time career in music and hasn't looked back.  In the
years since, she has produced two EPs for Perlon,
founded her own "Cassy" label, landed a residence at
Berlin's famed Panoramabar (also mixing their first ever
compilation), and collaborated with the likes of Ricardo
Villalobos, Luciano, Mathew Jonson, Steve Bug, and
Swayzak. Known for her smooth and soulful fusing of deep
house and minimal grooves, we are excited and honored to
introduce Cassy to SF with a 3 hour (100% vinyl!) West
Coast debut set.



plus special guests:

MONOCLE - Live PA

(racecar productions . nightlight music)

Monocle is the collaborative live project of Christina
Chatfield and Danny Patterson, two award-winning sound
designers that met while studying music technology at
the prestigious Berklee College of Music. Upon graduating
they relocated to SF, where they continue to write music
and perform together, and have produced tracks for
Racecar Productions and Alland's own Nightlight Music.
After a few months in hiding, they are pleased to debut an
all new live set for [KONTROL] that is sure to turn heads.



with [KONTROL] residents:

ALLAND BYALLO  (nightlight . auralism . leibe*detail)
SAMMY D  (dirtybird . utensil . magnificent 7)
NIKOLA BAYTALA  (s.w.a.t. . robsoul . junior boys own)
CRAIG KUNA  (platform . esdjco)


____________________________________________________


The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15 til 2am
http://www.theendup.com

FREE before 11pm!

____________________________________________________

http://www.kontrolsf.com

http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf

http://www.kontrolsf.com/K42/K42F.jpg

Flyer back:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K42/K42B.jpg

Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K42/K42P.jpg


___________________________________________________


CASSY

Catherine Britton aka Cassy left England for Austria with her Caribbean
father and Austrian mother in 1975. She spent her childhood in Vienna and
Lower Austria learning to sing and studying music at an early age. After
studying drama and acting in London for three years she returned to her
hometown of Vienna and began working in the theatre. But she soon gave up
acting when she realised she couldn't stand the profession.

Her first professional step into the electronic music world was as a
vocalist for Elin aka Autorepeat on 'Music Takes Me Higher' on Sabotage
Records. Electric Indigo was able to convince Cassy to not only involve
herself as a singer but to learn how to mix records.

After her first DJ gigs in Vienna, Munich and further productions, she met
Dave the Hustler in Geneva where they started working on a collaborative
project for Mental Groove, Cassy & Dave the Hustler. Geneva was also where
she met Luciano, co-producing 'La Ondita' on his album 'Blind Behaviour'.
She also co-produced 'Alpine Rocket' with Mathew Jonson for Perlon.

With her move to Berlin in March 2003, inspired by the clubscene and the
numerous number of artists living there and the abundance of the music she
fell in love with, she started becoming increasingly active in Berlin's club
scene and shortly after, became involved in projects with artists such as
Steve Bug and Ricardo Villalobos. She also started her solo project,
producing and singing.

Since then, she has founded her own label, "Cassy", where she will be
concentrating on releasing her own music, and she has recently finished her
first mix compilation for Berlin's Panoramabar, her club residency.


===> LINKS:

Cassy's Website:
http://www.cassybritton.com/

Cassy on MySpace (with music samples):
http://www.myspace.com/cassydjandmusic

http://www.discogs.com/artist/Cassy

http://www.ibiza-voice.com/story/news/1388

Interview with Cassy:
http://tinyurl.com/59cya6



____________________________________________________


MONOCLE

Monocle is a collaboration between two award-winning sound designers,
Christina Chatfield and Danny Patterson. The duo first met at the Berklee
College of Music in Boston, Massachusetts where they both studied music
technology. What began as a collaboration for class blossomed into a
full-fledged live PA and production team.

Originally from the Midwest, Christina's musical tastes were heavily
influenced by the sounds of nearby Detroit and Chicago. After spending her
teenage years at various electronic music events, she knew she wanted to
take her interest in the music to a higher level. With several years of
classical music training under her belt and a lifelong fascination with
sound design, Christina began studying music synthesis at Berklee in 2004.
In 2006 she was the recipient of the Laurie Anderson Women in Music
Technology award for her outstanding work at the college. In addition to
developing her many music projects--which include her solo productions as
Anitserk and collaborations with other artists in the works--Christina
produces sound design for visual media.

Danny hails from northern Florida where he was surrounded by computers since
early childhood. He began working with electronic music production as early
as 13 years old and hasn't stopped since. Danny's impressive resume already
boasts music production credits for his work on an Academy Award-winning
film and a top-selling Playstation game. Having previously studied computer
science, Danny is also a skilled programmer, often turning to programming
platforms like Supercollider and Composers Desktop Project to further create
and manipulate sound. In addition to working on his solo techno debut as
Coupler, Danny is currently putting his programming talents to use as a
software engineer developing music applications.

Monocle's debut release Dilleniidae (May 2007, Racecar Productions) was an
immediate success, drawing praise and plays from high-profile corners.
Shortly after its release, Dilleniidae appeared on several minimal download
charts, climbing to number 2 on Dance Tracks Digital and securing a place in
the top 40 on Juno Records.

Monocle's tracks expose listeners to a diverse spectrum of beats, ranging
anywhere from dark minimalist soundscapes to thoughtful analog melodies with
a groove. Both producers interject their own unique sound while effortlessly
blending together, resulting in dance music that conveys a deep
understanding of production and composition.


===> LINKS:

Monocle on MySpace (with music samples and discography):
http://www.myspace.com/monoclemusik

Monocle's Website:
http://www.monocle-music.com/


===> MUSIC:

Famous Sunglasses (recent live set):
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K42/monocle_-_famous_sunglasses.mp3


===> VIDEO:

Monocle - Live PA @ Aural Therapy 4.0, San Francisco 08.16.08
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VxOOeOrVEgU

Subject: [sfraves] One more week til UNDERGROUND RESISTANCE comes to SF! Faktion 11288: SANTIAGO SALAZAR!


Friday, 28 November 2008

RAY presents: 

F A K T I O N : san francisco's most erudite techno cult

Friday, 28 November 2008
SANTIAGO SALAZAR: UndergroundResistance|Los Hermanos [ Detroit|LA ]
FOREST GREEN: CuteFang|FnF|Faktion|SisterSF|DEF [ SF ]
OROTORO: FnF|Faktion [ SF ] vs DISCONNECT: DEF|Faktion [ SF ]
live webcast via Radio Integrated!

SANTIAGO SALAZAR may have moved to Detroit and proven himself there, but never
forgot his West Coast roots.  Having since returned to LA, he's played at
every major club and underground party in Southern California.

FOREST GREEN: Standard bearer for techno in San Francisco through even its
most silent days, Forest remains one of the busiest DJs in this city by the
bay, yet always manages to make each set a fresh and unique experience.
Recently returning to focus on production, she's still known for her ability
to select and mix tracks that get every audience dancing.

TORO TORO: Unorthodox, brilliant and just plain kickass, Toro Toro's
original style and track selection shows his industrial influence, yet
remains true to the principles of modern minimal, and the better examples
of electro house.  

DISCONNECT: Disconnect is a techno DJ currently based out of Oakland who
spins a dreamy, groovin' laid back style with a dash of progressive and
Neo Detroit thrown in.  He has been throwing underground parties with the
DEF crew since 2003, and is known for his depth and breadth of knowledge
of all things techno.


Yes, that's right, you're reading SANTIAGO SALAZAR as our featured guest
this month as thanks to you, loving techno fans.  Not much we can say except
how thankful we are to be able to bring him up here.  Santiago usually plays
in much bigger spaces so showing up early and enjoying our amazing residents
is recommended!  

You may note that resident Visualists Extraordinaire HEROIC ROBOT are not
listed.  They're busy fighting dozens of Sandiegoons and will not be available,
but you can catch them at the next Molekule party on 12/5!

4th Fridays @ Anu


Anu-Bar 
43 Sixth St., San Francisco, CA
9 PM to 2 AM 21+
Cost: $5 after 10pm

Official Site: http://www.faktionsf.com/
Official Site: http://www.heroicrobot.com/
Official Site: http://www.radiointegrated.com/

Subject: [sfraves] GalaxyRaver.com

I'm the founder / admin / developer for GalaxyRaver.com. The Apex 
production crew is not affiliated with the forum, but they consist of a 
lot of the first posters. This seems to be causing confusion. I know 
some of them and I want to say that even though they're inexperienced, 
they are in it for all the right reasons. I hear the recent party went well.

Rundown:
GalaxyRaver.com actually started out as a calendar project I wanted to 
develop for SF-Raves! I offered to develop the new SF-Raves calendar a 
long while ago, e-mailed karina and others multiple times and never got 
any responses. Frustrated, I figured all that was left of SF-Raves was 
this mailing list. Fed up with the lack of moderation and focused 
discussion on bayraves & ravelinks I decided to combine my calendar 
project with a forum and galaxyraver.com went online back in April. I 
started promoting to friends at parties, made up some fliers, and it has 
been growing steadily ever since. It is regularly maintained, updated, 
and moderated.

Please, I invite all of you on SF-Raves to at least check it out. I'd 
love to have more of the veteran sfraves crowd on the board. If you're a 
promoter, please feel free to add your event to the calendar.

 From the Welcome to Galaxy Raver thread:
"I created this forum to be a place on the internet for the Northern 
California underground. I wanted a forum that would keep the spirit 
alive for all lovers of electronic dance music / raves / freeparties / 
trance dances / full moon parties / etc. Here we can get together and 
discuss the music, the scene, and everything in between. This forum will 
be kept safe and regularly maintained and moderated so people can focus 
on building community and exchanging information."

Peace!
Alex (dreamdust)
galaxyraver.com

----- Original Message ----
From: Ray Wong <rayw@rayw.net>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org; def-announce@defsf.com
Cc: Ray Wong <rayw@rayw.net>
Sent: Thursday, November 20, 2008 2:46:44 AM
Subject: [sfraves] One more week til UNDERGROUND RESISTANCE comes to SF! Faktion 11288: SANTIAGO SALAZAR!


Friday, 28 November 2008

RAY presents:

F A K T I O N : san francisco's most erudite techno cult

Friday, 28 November 2008
SANTIAGO SALAZAR: UndergroundResistance|Los Hermanos [ Detroit|LA ]
FOREST GREEN: CuteFang|FnF|Faktion|SisterSF|DEF [ SF ]
OROTORO: FnF|Faktion [ SF ] vs DISCONNECT: DEF|Faktion [ SF ]
live webcast via Radio Integrated!

SANTIAGO SALAZAR may have moved to Detroit and proven himself there, but never
forgot his West Coast roots.  Having since returned to LA, he's played at
every major club and underground party in Southern California.

FOREST GREEN: Standard bearer for techno in San Francisco through even its
most silent days, Forest remains one of the busiest DJs in this city by the
bay, yet always manages to make each set a fresh and unique experience.
Recently returning to focus on production, she's still known for her ability
to select and mix tracks that get every audience dancing.

TORO TORO: Unorthodox, brilliant and just plain kickass, Toro Toro's
original style and track selection shows his industrial influence, yet
remains true to the principles of modern minimal, and the better examples
of electro house.

DISCONNECT: Disconnect is a techno DJ currently based out of Oakland who
spins a dreamy, groovin' laid back style with a dash of progressive and
Neo Detroit thrown in.  He has been throwing underground parties with the
DEF crew since 2003, and is known for his depth and breadth of knowledge
of all things techno.


Yes, that's right, you're reading SANTIAGO SALAZAR as our featured guest
this month as thanks to you, loving techno fans.  Not much we can say except
how thankful we are to be able to bring him up here.  Santiago usually plays
in much bigger spaces so showing up early and enjoying our amazing residents
is recommended!

You may note that resident Visualists Extraordinaire HEROIC ROBOT are not
listed.  They're busy fighting dozens of Sandiegoons and will not be available,
but you can catch them at the next Molekule party on 12/5!

4th Fridays @ Anu


Anu-Bar
43 Sixth St., San Francisco, CA
9 PM to 2 AM 21+
Cost: $5 after 10pm

Official Site: http://www.faktionsf.com/
Official Site: http://www.heroicrobot.com/
Official Site: http://www.radiointegrated.com/


///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: BRAF's ARTumnal Gathering (Sat 11/22)

For the Burner's Out there...
and por favor... no little flameware o
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This benefit is for Burning Mans sister Non-Profit art foundations grant 
and public art program around the world. Please spread the word as it's 
coming up quickly and people should get their tix ahead of time!

The Black Rock Arts Foundation presents
The ARTumnal Gathering: Tribes and Treasures
Saturday, November 22, 2008
9pm to 3am (Get there for the start and stay all night!)
at The Historic Bently Reserve http://www.bentlyreserve.com
400 Sansome St.
San Francisco, CA 94111
$20 Presale for Main Event; $30 at the door (so get your tix now!) Pre-event 
Dinner tix start at $150 for sumptuous BANK-quet Purchase tickets and get 
info: http://blackrockarts.org

Join us in support of the Black Rock Arts Foundation's mission to inspire 
art, community and civic participation worldwide. Revel in the richness of 
human expression, generosity of spirit and camaraderie of artists and 
visionaries.

An opulent gathering of tribes in celebration of our artistic treasures and 
vital community spirit awaits! Partake in an evening of abundant visual 
delights, auditory pleasures, beguiling libations, and a cornucopia of 
spectacular people, art and performances.

Performances By

Black Rock City Ballet
Brass Menaeri  (2008 Best of The Bay World Music Winners) 
brass.menazeri.com/
Chances End  violin-electronica www.chancesend.com
Clark Hamon (Deep End)  www.myspace.com/clarkhamon
Copper Lantern Fire Theater copperlantern.org/
Dex Stakker http://dexstakker.com
Dragn'fly www.djdragnfly.com
Erica Mulkey www.unwoman.com
Fou Fou HA! http://www.foufouha.com/
Gaucho  Gypsy jazz  www.gauchojazz.com
Laird (Get Freaky!) www.djlaird.org
Lila Sklar www.lilasviolin.com
Loyd Family Players www.theloydfamilyplayers.com/
Majitope (Symbiosis/Lowpro) www.majitope.com/
Tamo (Angels of bAss) www.angelsofbass.com/Angels/Home.html
Vau De Vire Society (2008 Best of The Bay Circus Troupe Winners) 
www.vaudeviresociety.com/
Secret special guest Dj (and his monkeysnake...shh!)
 and MANY other amazing performers and artists!!!

Chill room with dcor provided by Hookahdome/RuckusLab 
http://hookahdome.com/
Photo portraits by Nightshade www.theblight.net

Tickets:

Black Rock Arts is a 501(c)3 non-prot; a portion of your ticket price is 
tax-deductible. To purchase tickets, www.blackrockarts.org

The MAIN EVENT, in the Grand Hall and Chill Space:

The Tribes & Treasures Celebration:
9:00pm-3:00am, $20 presale online, $30 at the door
Includes an evening of featured and roaming performances, DJs, dancing, 
raffle, photography sale and many happy surprises

The Special Pre-event Reception, Upstairs:

The Bank-quet Dinner
7:00pm-3:00am, $150
Includes a sumptuous buffet dinner, silent auction, ambient performances, 
absinthe tasting, wine and dessert, presentations by celebrated BRAF artists 
and organizers; The Finch Mob-creators of the Panhandle Bandshell, Peter 
Hudson-creator of Homouroboros, and Crimson Rose, presenting the art of The 
Mangrove, and entry to the main event.

Alchemists' Hour and Bank-quet Dinner
6:00pm-3:00am, $250
Includes private reception with the BRAF Board of Directors and special 
guests, with a hosted bar from 6:00pm-7:00pm + the Bank-quet Dinner + main 
event.

Host Committee:
Christopher & Amber Bently; David Best; Jess Bobier; Loren & Rachel 
Carpenter; Will Chase; Harley K. Dubois; Alexeis Fillipello; Marian Goodell; 
Syd Gris; Freddy Hahne; Dana Harrison; Larry Harvey; Aaryn Herridge; Mark 
Higbie; Phil Linhares; Nick Morgan; John Mueller; Jessica Mullens; Joseph 
Olivier; Orange; Will Roger Peterson; Christina Pettigrew; Rae Richman; 
Crimson Rose; Alix Rosenthal; David Silverman; Jeremy Sugerman

The Black Rock Arts Foundation supports interactive art projects worldwide, 
year-round. In our seven years of collaborating with innovative artists, 
visionaries and community groups, we've seen first hand how interactive art 
can inspire civic engagement and social participation.

Our 2008 Grantee and Civic Art projects are inspiring examples of both 
groundbreaking works of art and new levels of community ownership and 
participation. Projects like The Temple of the American Dream in Detroit, 
MI, Peter Hudson's Homourboros in San Jose, CA, and The Mangrove in Reno, NV 
brought innovative works of art into the every day lives of the public, many 
of whom have little access to such large scale interactive works. All of 
these projects relied on the support of their communities, and hundreds of 
volunteers.

Come celebrate our achievements as a community, and support the 
proliferation of interactive art!!!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GalaxyRaver.com

i love good dreamers.

dreamdust wrote:
> I'm the founder / admin / developer for GalaxyRaver.com. The Apex 
> production crew is not affiliated with the forum, but they consist of 
> a lot of the first posters. This seems to be causing confusion. I know 
> some of them and I want to say that even though they're inexperienced, 
> they are in it for all the right reasons. I hear the recent party went 
> well.
>
> Rundown:
> GalaxyRaver.com actually started out as a calendar project I wanted to 
> develop for SF-Raves! I offered to develop the new SF-Raves calendar a 
> long while ago, e-mailed karina and others multiple times and never 
> got any responses. Frustrated, I figured all that was left of SF-Raves 
> was this mailing list. Fed up with the lack of moderation and focused 
> discussion on bayraves & ravelinks I decided to combine my calendar 
> project with a forum and galaxyraver.com went online back in April. I 
> started promoting to friends at parties, made up some fliers, and it 
> has been growing steadily ever since. It is regularly maintained, 
> updated, and moderated.
>
> Please, I invite all of you on SF-Raves to at least check it out. I'd 
> love to have more of the veteran sfraves crowd on the board. If you're 
> a promoter, please feel free to add your event to the calendar.
>
> From the Welcome to Galaxy Raver thread:
> "I created this forum to be a place on the internet for the Northern 
> California underground. I wanted a forum that would keep the spirit 
> alive for all lovers of electronic dance music / raves / freeparties / 
> trance dances / full moon parties / etc. Here we can get together and 
> discuss the music, the scene, and everything in between. This forum 
> will be kept safe and regularly maintained and moderated so people can 
> focus on building community and exchanging information."
>
> Peace!
> Alex (dreamdust)
> galaxyraver.com
>
>

--- On Fri, 11/21/08, sean ocean <seanocean@defsf.com> wrote:

From: sean ocean <seanocean@defsf.com>
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GalaxyRaver.com
To:

i love good dreamers.

dreamdust wrote:
> I'm the founder / admin / developer for GalaxyRaver.com. The Apex
production crew is not affiliated with the forum, but they consist of a lot of
the first posters. This seems to be causing confusion. I know some of them and I
want to say that even though they're inexperienced, they are in it for all
the right reasons. I hear the recent party went well.
> 
> Rundown:
> GalaxyRaver.com actually started out as a calendar project I wanted to
develop for SF-Raves! I offered to develop the new SF-Raves calendar a long
while ago, e-mailed karina and others multiple times and never got any
responses. Frustrated, I figured all that was left of SF-Raves was this mailing
list. Fed up with the lack of moderation and focused discussion on bayraves
& ravelinks I decided to combine my calendar project with a forum and
galaxyraver.com went online back in April. I started promoting to friends at
parties, made up some fliers, and it has been growing steadily ever since. It is
regularly maintained, updated, and moderated.
> 
> Please, I invite all of you on SF-Raves to at least check it out. I'd
love to have more of the veteran sfraves crowd on the board. If you're a
promoter, please feel free to add your event to the calendar.
> 
> From the Welcome to Galaxy Raver thread:
> "I created this forum to be a place on the internet for the Northern
California underground. I wanted a forum that would keep the spirit alive for
all lovers of electronic dance music / raves / freeparties / trance dances /
full moon parties / etc. Here we can get together and discuss the music, the
scene, and everything in between. This forum will be kept safe and regularly
maintained and moderated so people can focus on building community and
exchanging information."
> 
> Peace!
> Alex (dreamdust)
> galaxyraver.com
> 
>

----- Original Message ----
From: sean ocean <seanocean@defsf.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Friday, November 21, 2008 1:39:34 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GalaxyRaver.com

i love good dreamers.

dreamdust wrote:
> I'm the founder / admin / developer for GalaxyRaver.com. The Apex production crew is not affiliated with the forum, but they consist of a lot of the first posters. This seems to be causing confusion. I know some of them and I want to say that even though they're inexperienced, they are in it for all the right reasons. I hear the recent party went well.
> 
> Rundown:
> GalaxyRaver.com actually started out as a calendar project I wanted to develop for SF-Raves! I offered to develop the new SF-Raves calendar a long while ago, e-mailed karina and others multiple times and never got any responses. Frustrated, I figured all that was left of SF-Raves was this mailing list. Fed up with the lack of moderation and focused discussion on bayraves & ravelinks I decided to combine my calendar project with a forum and galaxyraver.com went online back in April. I started promoting to friends at parties, made up some fliers, and it has been growing steadily ever since. It is regularly maintained, updated, and moderated.
> 
> Please, I invite all of you on SF-Raves to at least check it out. I'd love to have more of the veteran sfraves crowd on the board. If you're a promoter, please feel free to add your event to the calendar.
> 
> From the Welcome to Galaxy Raver thread:
> "I created this forum to be a place on the internet for the Northern California underground. I wanted a forum that would keep the spirit alive for all lovers of electronic dance music / raves / freeparties / trance dances / full moon parties / etc. Here we can get together and discuss the music, the scene, and everything in between. This forum will be kept safe and regularly maintained and moderated so people can focus on building community and exchanging information."
> 
> Peace!
> Alex (dreamdust)
> galaxyraver.com
> 
>

It's been a quick minute... or rather a few months for that minute.  I
finally got around to posting this kick ass that Mo gave me on Qpod.  Go
check it out and support your SFR alum!  In case you aren't familiar with
Mo's sound[s], here's a tracklist for ya!

www.qpod.org

1.   Dr. James E. Walton - Meditation to Improve Focus and Concentration
2.   Pierce & Jerl - Bouquet
3.   Angel Freq - Nothing At All (Jamie Stevens Pacific Dub)
4.   Autumn Tree - Kubi
5.   B Noise - Endless Summer (NTFO Refact Mix)
6.   Robert Babicz - Don't Look Back
7.   Bart Skils & Anton Pieete - Handsome
8.   Cave - Hartbreak
9.   Quivver - Surin (Tobias Lutzenkirchen Remix)
10.  Lutzenkirchen - Corroder
11.  Mastercris - Wake Me in the Next Summer

------=_Part_105305_14148913.1227283663124--

Ok - so maybe David Bowie isn't exactly "punk" but during the era he put th=
is tune out=2C and the tune itself - this was still pretty fuckin' punk. Fo=
r purists they may argue it's "glam" but so were the New York Dolls and Joh=
nny Thunders....and what?

Without further adieu...

"Suffragette City" by David Bowie=20

(hey man) oh leave me alone you know

My favorite quote from Hakim Bey --=20
_____________________________
=20

"The battle lines are drawn.

Chaos is not entropy,

Chaos is not death,

Chaos is not a commodity.

Chaos is continual creation.

Chaos never died.

=20

Oppose all forms of law and authority in the name of Chaos."

_______________________________

Here's to all the ravers finding their own Temporary Autonomous zones
this weekend. :-)

Peace,
-Dan


-----Original Message-----
From: electrofunk138@hotmail.com [mailto:electrofunk138@hotmail.com]=20
Sent: Friday, November 21, 2008 12:30 PM
To: SF Raves
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Punk QOTD


Ok - so maybe David Bowie isn't exactly "punk" but during the era he put
this tune out, and the tune itself - this was still pretty fuckin' punk.
For purists they may argue it's "glam" but so were the New York Dolls
and Johnny Thunders....and what?

Without further adieu...

"Suffragette City" by David Bowie=20

(hey man) oh leave me alone you know
(hey man) oh henry, get off the phone, I gotta
(hey man) I gotta straighten my face
This mellow thighed chick just put my spine out of place

(hey man) my schooldays insane
(hey man) my works down the drain
(hey man) well shes a total blam-blam
She said she had to squeeze it but she..and then she..

Oh dont lean on me man, cause you cant afford the ticket
Im back from suffragette city
Oh dont lean on me man
Cause you aint got time to check it
You know my suffragette city
Is outta sight...shes all right

(hey man) ah henry, dont be unkind, go away
(hey man) I cant take you this time, no way
(hey man) droogie dont crash here
Theres only room for one and here she comes, here she comes

Oh dont lean on me man, cause you cant afford the ticket
Im back on suffragette city
Oh dont lean on me man
Cause you aint got time to check it
You know my suffragette city
Is outta sight...shes all right

Oh hit me!

Oh dont lean on me man, cause you cant afford the ticket
Im back from suffragette city
Oh dont lean on me man
Cause you aint got time to check it
You know my suffragette city
Dont lean on me man, cause you cant afford the ticket
Im back from suffragette city
Oh dont lean on me man
Cause you aint got time to check it
You know my suffragette city
Is outta sight...shes all right

A suffragette city, a suffragette city
Im back on suffragette city, Im back on suffragette city
Ooo, sufraggete city, ooo, suffragette city
Oooh-how, sufragette city, oooh-how, sufragette,

Ohhh, wham bam thank you ma'am!
A suffragette city, a suffragette city
Quite all right
A suffragette city
Too fine
A suffragette city, ooh, a sufragette city
Oh, my sufragette city, oh my suffragette city
Oh, suffragette
Suffragette!

--0-1666918488-1227303171=:65333
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

thanks again ben for showcasing my mix on QPOD. i'm very happy to be part of a project that aims to highlight how we do things on the west coast. 

for those of you who haven't heard my techier side, this mix captures it well. i'm really picky about techno sounds (i find a lot of it too cold), but this 51 minutes is a proper buffet of deep, melodic, progressive tech-house and techno. i'd be lying if i said it didn't build into some more banging moments though ;)

anyways, enjoy. this mix is helping me hold on to a little piece of summer while i freeze my ass off here in london. 

love,
mo

*bliss does not require ignorance*

--- On Fri, 11/21/08, Ben Haus <benhaus@gmail.com> wrote:
From: Ben Haus <benhaus@gmail.com>
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Speaking of new mixes... Mo Corleone on Qpod
To: "The Twilight Laser Outpost (West)" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Date: Friday, November 21, 2008, 10:07 AM

It's been a quick minute... or rather a few months for that minute.  I
finally got around to posting this kick ass that Mo gave me on Qpod.  Go
check it out and support your SFR alum!  In case you aren't familiar with
Mo's sound[s], here's a tracklist for ya!

www.qpod.org

1.   Dr. James E. Walton - Meditation to Improve Focus and Concentration
2.   Pierce & Jerl - Bouquet
3.   Angel Freq - Nothing At All (Jamie Stevens Pacific Dub)
4.   Autumn Tree - Kubi
5.   B Noise - Endless Summer (NTFO Refact Mix)
6.   Robert Babicz - Don't Look Back
7.   Bart Skils & Anton Pieete - Handsome
8.   Cave - Hartbreak
9.   Quivver - Surin (Tobias Lutzenkirchen Remix)
10.  Lutzenkirchen - Corroder
11.  Mastercris - Wake Me in the Next Summer



      
--0-1666918488-1227303171=:65333--

> dreamdust wrote:
>> I'm the founder / admin / developer for GalaxyRaver.com. The Apex
> production crew is not affiliated with the forum, but they consist of a 
> lot of
> the first posters. This seems to be causing confusion. I know some of them 
> and I
> want to say that even though they're inexperienced, they are in it for all
> the right reasons. I hear the recent party went well.
>>
>> Rundown:
>> GalaxyRaver.com actually started out as a calendar project I wanted to
> develop for SF-Raves! I offered to develop the new SF-Raves calendar a 
> long
> while ago, e-mailed karina and others multiple times and never got any
> responses. Frustrated, I figured all that was left of SF-Raves was this 
> mailing
> list. Fed up with the lack of moderation and focused discussion on 
> bayraves
> & ravelinks I decided to combine my calendar project with a forum and
> galaxyraver.com went online back in April. I started promoting to friends 
> at
> parties, made up some fliers, and it has been growing steadily ever since. 
> It is
> regularly maintained, updated, and moderated.
>>
>> Please, I invite all of you on SF-Raves to at least check it out. I'd
> love to have more of the veteran sfraves crowd on the board. If you're a
> promoter, please feel free to add your event to the calendar.
>>
>> From the Welcome to Galaxy Raver thread:
>> "I created this forum to be a place on the internet for the Northern
> California underground. I wanted a forum that would keep the spirit alive 
> for
> all lovers of electronic dance music / raves / freeparties / trance dances 
> /
> full moon parties / etc. Here we can get together and discuss the music, 
> the
> scene, and everything in between. This forum will be kept safe and 
> regularly
> maintained and moderated so people can focus on building community and
> exchanging information."
>>
>> Peace!
>> Alex (dreamdust)
>> galaxyraver.com

yeah, i have to admit my early email was more a function of being on london time than of me being some kind of motivated morning person :D

and you can bet your ass i would have been all about prohibition had i been in the country! that bash is easily the one i've been most bummed to miss. and i agree that i was born for a party like that... gangster dj name, card carrying member of the ambient mafia, and plenty of rockin' outfits to fit the theme.

i'm a little bit jealous but so happy that the event went off... it sounds to me like it was *the* party of 2008. america... fuck yeah!

london is getting more awesome by the day. i'm just now settled in enough to start sampling the party scene. so far i've seen dj food (of ninja tune fame) play acid techno, caught the last fat! records party at a space called the end that is sadly closing its doors soon, and this weekend it's a day event called rainbow value and then a squat party (london warehouse renegade) with some of my friends that are coming in from dublin.

and you guys are going to kill me, but i'm totally getting into bhangra and i'm going to play the shit out of it when i get home.

miss you bay area crazies!

love,
mo

*bliss does not require ignorance*

> >> Rundown:
> >> GalaxyRaver.com actually started out as a calendar project I wanted to
> > develop for SF-Raves! I offered to develop the new SF-Raves calendar a 
> > long
> > while ago, e-mailed karina and others multiple times and never got any
> > responses. Frustrated, I figured all that was left of SF-Raves was this 
> > mailing
> > list. Fed up with the lack of moderation and focused discussion on 
> > bayraves
> > & ravelinks I decided to combine my calendar project with a forum and
> > galaxyraver.com went online back in April. I started promoting to friends 
> > at
> > parties, made up some fliers, and it has been growing steadily ever since.
> 
> > It is
> > regularly maintained, updated, and moderated.
> >>
> >> Please, I invite all of you on SF-Raves to at least check it out.
> I'd
> > love to have more of the veteran sfraves crowd on the board. If you're
> a
> > promoter, please feel free to add your event to the calendar.

> >> From the Welcome to Galaxy Raver thread:
> >> "I created this forum to be a place on the internet for the
> Northern
> > California underground. I wanted a forum that would keep the spirit alive 
> > for
> > all lovers of electronic dance music / raves / freeparties / trance dances

> > /
> > full moon parties / etc. Here we can get together and discuss the music,

I've been thinking=A0lately about the mixes I post here every now and then =
and=A0realised that something is starting to bother me a little bit. I know=
 I don't post here much, but I do monitor the list to see whats going on an=
d I've been on the list for years, probably 10 or more. I try to do a new m=
ix every month or at least every other month and I post here=A0to share the=
m.=A0I mean why not, they are free to download/stream and=A0I figure a few =
people may enjoy them which is all I care about in the end. It's my small w=
ay of contributing something.=0A=0AThe thing=A0that is starting to bother m=
e a little though is that it seems like they go 100% ignored here and I get=
 the feeling I'm wasting my time posting them. Don't get me wrong, I'm no a=
ttention whore and attention is not at all what I'm after.=A0Seriously thou=
gh out of the last 5 times I posted a mix here a grand total 1 person respo=
nded to me and=A0gave a simple thanks for=A0some new music to check out. I =
guess its just that a little feedback would be nice, to see if anyone even =
likes them at all or not. And=A0hey if they suck.... tell me they suck, tha=
ts fine too lol.=0A=0ASo I guess what I want to know is, am I doing somethi=
ng wrong the way I post them? If so please let me know what it is so I can =
change it. Or worse yet am I just coming off like a spammer or something? I=

Subject: [sfraves] Some Detroit Techno courtesy of Santiago Salazar on 11/28

Saw this come across the radar and figured some of you would be 
interested!!  Wish I were in town to enjoy it!

F A K T I O N : san francisco's most erudite techno cult

Friday, 28 November 2008
SANTIAGO SALAZAR: UndergroundResistance|Los Hermanos [ Detroit|LA ]
FOREST GREEN: CuteFang|FnF|Faktion|SisterSF|DEF [ SF ]
OROTORO: FnF|Faktion [ SF ] vs DISCONNECT: DEF|Faktion [ SF ]
live webcast via Radio Integrated!

SANTIAGO SALAZAR may have moved to Detroit and proven himself there, but never
forgot his West Coast roots.  Having since returned to LA, he's played at every
major club and underground party in Southern California.
http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewProfile&friendID=646596
49

FOREST GREEN: Standard bearer for techno in San Francisco through even its
most silent days, Forest remains one of the busiest DJs in this city by the
bay, yet always manages to make each set a fresh and unique experience.
Recently returning to focus on production, she's still known for her ability
to select and mix tracks that get every audience dancing.

TORO TORO: Unorthodox, brilliant and just plain kickass, Toro Toro's
original style and track selection shows his industrial influence, yet
remains true to the principles of modern minimal, and the better examples
of electro house.

DISCONNECT: Disconnect is a techno DJ currently based out of Oakland who
spins a dreamy, groovin' laid back style with a dash of progressive and
Neo Detroit thrown in.  He has been throwing underground parties with the
DEF crew since 2003, and is known for his depth and breadth of knowledge
of all things techno.


Yes, that's right, you're reading SANTIAGO SALAZAR as our featured guest
this month as thanks to you, loving techno fans.  Not much we can say except
how thankful we are to be able to bring him up here.  Santiago usually plays
in much bigger spaces so showing up early and enjoying our amazing residents
is recommended!

You may note that resident Visualists Extraordinaire HEROIC ROBOT are not
listed.  They're busy fighting dozens of Sandiegoons and will not be available,
but you can catch them at the next Molekule party on 12/5!

4th Fridays @ Anu


Anu-Bar
43 Sixth St., San Francisco, CA
9 PM to 2 AM 21+
Cost: $5 after 10pm

Official Site: http://www.faktionsf.com/
Official Site: http://www.heroicrobot.com/
Official Site: http://www.defsf.com/




-- 
San Francisco Bay Guardian's Readers Choice Award Winner: Best Radio DJ:
http://www.sfbg.com/promo/pollpositions.php
AIM: jckzsu (or kzsudj during my show.)

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Around Turkey Day=2C I always think of my pals in this band whom I got to g=
et to know and become friends with when I lived down the street from their =
studio in Ft.Collins=2C CO.

"Suburban Home" by The Descendents

I want to be stereotyped

I want to be classified

I want to be a clone

I want a suburban home

Suburban home

Suburban home

Suburban home

I want to be masochistic

I want to be a statistic

I want to be a clone

I want a suburban home

Suburban home

Suburban home

Suburban home

I don't want no hippie pad

I want a house just

Like mom and dad

I want to be stereotyped

I want to be classified

I want to be masochistic

I want to be a statistic

I want to be a clone

I want a suburban home

Suburban home

Suburban home

Suburban home

Date: Fri, 28 Nov 2008 16:20:52 -0800
From: Ray Wong <rayw@rayw.net>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org, def-announce@defsf.com
Message-ID: <20081129002052.GR11913@jmmredux.doomba.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Disposition: inline
User-Agent: Mutt/1.5.13 (2006-08-11)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] yes! Tonight! UNDERGROUND RESISTANCE comes to SF! Faktion 11288: SANTIAGO SALAZAR!


Friday, 28 November 2008

RAY presents: 

F A K T I O N : san francisco's thankful techno cult

Friday, 28 November 2008
SANTIAGO SALAZAR: UndergroundResistance|Los Hermanos [ Detroit|LA ]
FOREST GREEN: CuteFang|FnF|Faktion|SisterSF|DEF [ SF ]
OROTORO: FnF|Faktion [ SF ] vs DISCONNECT: DEF|Faktion [ SF ]
live webcast via Radio Integrated!

SANTIAGO SALAZAR may have moved to Detroit and proven himself there, but never
forgot his West Coast roots.  Having since returned to LA, he's played at
every major club and underground party in Southern California.

FOREST GREEN: Standard bearer for techno in San Francisco through even its
most silent days, Forest remains one of the busiest DJs in this city by the
bay, yet always manages to make each set a fresh and unique experience.
Recently returning to focus on production, she's still known for her ability
to select and mix tracks that get every audience dancing.

TORO TORO: Unorthodox, brilliant and just plain kickass, Toro Toro's
original style and track selection shows his industrial influence, yet
remains true to the principles of modern minimal, and the better examples
of electro house.  

DISCONNECT: Disconnect is a techno DJ currently based out of Oakland who
spins a dreamy, groovin' laid back style with a dash of progressive and
Neo Detroit thrown in.  He has been throwing underground parties with the
DEF crew since 2003, and is known for his depth and breadth of knowledge
of all things techno.


Yes, that's right, you're reading SANTIAGO SALAZAR as our featured guest
this month as thanks to you, loving techno fans.  Not much we can say except
how thankful we are to be able to bring him up here.  Santiago usually plays
in much bigger spaces so showing up early and enjoying our amazing residents
is recommended!  

You may note that resident Visualists Extraordinaire HEROIC ROBOT are not
listed.  They're busy fighting dozens of Sandiegoons and will not be available,
but you can catch them at the next Molekule party on 12/5!

4th Fridays @ Anu


Anu-Bar 
43 Sixth St., San Francisco, CA
9 PM to 2 AM 21+
Cost: $5 after 10pm

Official Site: http://www.faktionsf.com/
Official Site: http://www.heroicrobot.com/
Official Site: http://www.radiointegrated.com/

 
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 

----- End forwarded message -----

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] Tune in tonight Radio Integrated Live from FAKTION



Tune in now to hear tonight's all star lineup at Faktion, or better yet, come
on down to Anu, 43 6th Street between Market and Mission in SF.

 the URL:
 
 http://radio.defsf.com:1200/


Friday, 28 November 2008

RAY presents: 

F A K T I O N : san francisco's most erudite techno cult

Friday, 28 November 2008
SANTIAGO SALAZAR: UndergroundResistance|Los Hermanos [ Detroit|LA ]
FOREST GREEN: CuteFang|FnF|Faktion|SisterSF|DEF [ SF ]
OROTORO: FnF|Faktion [ SF ] vs DISCONNECT: DEF|Faktion [ SF ]
live webcast via Radio Integrated!

SANTIAGO SALAZAR may have moved to Detroit and proven himself there, but never
forgot his West Coast roots.  Having since returned to LA, he's played at
every major club and underground party in Southern California.

FOREST GREEN: Standard bearer for techno in San Francisco through even its
most silent days, Forest remains one of the busiest DJs in this city by the
bay, yet always manages to make each set a fresh and unique experience.
Recently returning to focus on production, she's still known for her ability
to select and mix tracks that get every audience dancing.

TORO TORO: Unorthodox, brilliant and just plain kickass, Toro Toro's
original style and track selection shows his industrial influence, yet
remains true to the principles of modern minimal, and the better examples
of electro house.  

DISCONNECT: Disconnect is a techno DJ currently based out of Oakland who
spins a dreamy, groovin' laid back style with a dash of progressive and
Neo Detroit thrown in.  He has been throwing underground parties with the
DEF crew since 2003, and is known for his depth and breadth of knowledge
of all things techno.


Yes, that's right, you're reading SANTIAGO SALAZAR as our featured guest
this month as thanks to you, loving techno fans.  Not much we can say except
how thankful we are to be able to bring him up here.  Santiago usually plays
in much bigger spaces so showing up early and enjoying our amazing residents
is recommended!  

You may note that resident Visualists Extraordinaire HEROIC ROBOT are not
listed.  They're busy fighting dozens of Sandiegoons and will not be available,
but you can catch them at the next Molekule party on 12/5!

4th Fridays @ Anu


Anu-Bar 
43 Sixth St., San Francisco, CA
9 PM to 2 AM 21+
Cost: $5 after 10pm

Official Site: http://www.faktionsf.com/
Official Site: http://www.heroicrobot.com/
Official Site: http://www.radiointegrated.com/

 
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

This is it! Less then a week to go! Hope you can make it out=2C its going=20
to be a fabulous night=2C filled with good people and great times!
=20
:)
=20
Yes thats right! The Infamous Stilldream Holiday Party
and Canned Food Drive returns December 5th=2C 2008!
=20
[[[STILLDREAM]]]
Holiday Party and Canned Food Drive
December 5th=2C 2008
Sacramento=2C CA
=20
With djs:
=20
[[MANCUB]] - Spacecowboys - SF
If you haven't heard this guys play=2C seen him scratch then prepare=20
yourself!
This is his first appearance at a Stilldream event=2C be ready for him to=20
tear
the roof off!
=20
[[Jon E. Qwest]] - United Vibes / Release / Plan B
[[G.A.M.M.A. & Mek]] - Stilldream / Left Coast Techno / Signal
[[Nick Nyquil]] - Stilldream / Nocturnalism
[[Malacai]] - Middleground
=20
Holiday Party Xtras:
- Get your picture taken with St. Nick Nyquil
- Free Christmas Candy
- Mistle Tow under every door way to help you spread your Holiday Cheer!
- Dress up! Wear those Santa Hats and tacky holiday sweaters!
=20
Admission:
- $5 General Admission
- $3 w/ Canned Food
- FREE w/ Canned Food & Stilldream Membership
=20
Located at:
Silk Bar
1011 Del Paso Blvd
Sacramento=2C CA
=20
9PM-2AM
=20
Donations will be going to the Sacramento Food Bank and Family Services!
=20
* Feel free to bring more then 1 canned food and we will also be=20
accepting jacket donations. Everything during these hard times counts!
